decision_conditions: The applicant should be aware that Part 10, Chapter 1 of the Air Navigation Order 2016 makes it an offence to 'recklessly or negligently act in a manner to endanger an aircraft, or any person in an aircraft', best practice guidance contained in both Civil Aviation Publication 738 (Safeguarding of Aerodromes) and the British Standard Institute Code of Practice for the safe use of crane (BS7121 Part 1) indicate that a crane user should, where a crane exceeds a height of 10m and would be within 6km of an aerodrome/airfield, consult with a local aerodrome manager for permission to operate a crane.
In order to minimise risk, it is strongly advised that:
1. The developer/contractor or crane user should contact the Cranes Permit Team at RAF Northolt (Nor-OpsCranePermits@mod.gov.uk), in order to secure a crane permit from the airfield.
2. A deconfliction strategy is developed and agreed with the Cranes Permit Team at RAF Northolt to ensure the proposed works will not conflict with the MODs
description: Details pursuant to Condition 17 (Construction Management Strategy) of planning permission 11891/APP/2016/3583 dated 14/11/2017 (Demolition of all existing single/two storey buildings including outbuildings within the site and erection of residential development comprising 69 residential units, 80 car parking spaces and associated works.)
